intro: Arrabidaea parviflora var. typica, commonly known as the small-flowered arrabidaea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces legume-like pods that contain seeds. The species is of interest to botanists due to its ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
